author: sproul
content:
I tend to agree.

I think the future of sync is proper state sync, and don’t see any value in limiting checkpoint sync to the start of the weak subjectivity period.

I had a go at using <@!833706406699073536>’s checkpoint sync implementation in Prysm, and it has a nice fallback already for when the weak subjectivity API doesn’t exist. The API could remain Prysm-only or optional in the standard IMO
